Issues.Title: ci: publish snapshots job is unable to decode github token
Issues.Body:
The publish_snapshots job is currently not able to decode the Github
token because the openssl version changed. This is because the default
digest for more recent openssl versions has most likely changed and the github
token file has been encrypted with an old digest. We need to ensure
that the md5 digest is used for decryption as that matches the
digest used for encryption.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed or merged PR "ci: publish snapshots job is unable to decode github token" (#31099)

Issues.Title: Base Href appending to url
Issues.Body:
Hello i am working in an ionic project but i opened a ticket with them and they said its an angular issue as the routing comes from angular

looked for issues pertaining to this i'm using ionic in a dynamically served way. for users to access their administration panel they just browse to http://domain.com/admin i was able to get the app loading correctly from changing the `<base href="/">` to `<base href="admin/">` and on the server the urls requested are correct eg

```
domain.com\admin\runtime.js
domain.com\admin\polyfills.js
domain.com\admin\styles.js
domain.com\admin\vendor.js
domain.com\admin\main.js
domain.com\admin\2.js
domain.com\admin\common.js
domain.com\admin\162.js
domain.com\admin\96.js
domain.com\admin\home-home-module.js
domain.com\admin\6.js
domain.com\admin\4.js
domain.com\admin\3.js
domain.com\admin\assets\icon\favicon.png
```
which is turned into

```
ionic_directory\www\runtime.js
ionic_directory\www\polyfills.js
ionic_directory\www\styles.js
ionic_directory\www\vendor.js
ionic_directory\www\main.js
ionic_directory\www\2.js
ionic_directory\www\common.js
ionic_directory\www\162.js
ionic_directory\www\96.js
ionic_directory\www\home-home-module.js
ionic_directory\www\6.js
ionic_directory\www\4.js
ionic_directory\www\3.js
```
all of the file serving is fine however the issue is that now the url get the admin/ base append onto when its already there turning `http://domain.com/admin` into `http://domain.com/admin/admin/`

### IONIC INFO
ionic (Ionic CLI)             : 4.7.1 (C:\Users\Brian\AppData\Roaming\npm\node_modules\ionic)
   Ionic Framework               : @ionic/angular 4.4.0
   @angular-devkit/build-angular : 0.13.9
   @angular-devkit/schematics    : 7.3.9
   @angular/cli                  : 7.3.9
   @ionic/angular-toolkit        : 1.5.1

Issues.Body:
# ğŸ“š Docs or angular.io bug report

### Description

On the Angular Proxy Documentation page, under Proxying to a Backend Server, in the [Corporate Proxy](https://angular.io/guide/build#using-corporate-proxy) section, there is the following typo.


## ğŸ”¬ Minimal Reproduction

### What's the affected URL?**
https://angular.io/guide/build#using-corporate-proxy

### Reproduction Steps**
<!-- If applicable please list the steps to take to reproduce the issue -->
Read site

### Expected vs Actual Behavior**
<!-- If applicable please describe the difference between the expected and actual behavior after following the repro steps. -->
Actual Sentence: "If you work behind a corporate proxy, **the** cannot directly proxy calls to any URL outside your local network."

Expected Sentence:

Issues.Title: refactor(compiler): recursive ast expression visitor not passing context
Issues.Body:
Currently the `RecursiveAstVisitor` that is part of the template expression
parser does not _always_ properly pass through the context that can be
specified when visting a given expression. Only a handful of AST types
pass through the context while others are accidentally left out. This causes
unexpected and inconsistent behavior and basically makes the `context`
parameter not usable if the type of template expression is not known.

e.g. the template variable assignment migration currently depends on
the `RecursiveAstVisitor` but sometimes breaks if developers use
things like conditionals in their template variable assignments.

Fixes #31043
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open PR "refactor(compiler): recursive ast expression visitor not passing context" (#31085)

Issues.Title: Production build, css minification of transition properties.
Issues.Body:
# ğŸ bug report ### Affected Package angular/cli ### Description Bug occurs when using all properties of a transition if multiple values are used. This is using the regular properties not the short hand. ``` { transition-property: opacity, transform; transition-duration: 500ms; transition-timing-function: ease-in-out; transition-delay: 50ms; } ``` will produce: `{transition:opacity .5s ease-in-out 50ms}` meaning the `transform` value is lost. Expected outcome is tricky since it's a minification and the length of the result is important. but most of the time probably just a shorthand property: `transition:opacity .5s ease-in-out 50ms,transform .5s ease-in-out 50ms;` but in instances where longer values are used, overrides might be shorter using: `transition:.5s cubic-bezier(0.675, 0.040, 0.490, 0.940) 50ms;transition-property:opacity,transform;` instead of: `transition:opacity .5s cubic-bezier(0.675, 0.040, 0.490, 0.940) 50ms,transform 500ms cubic-bezier(0.675, 0.040, 0.490, 0.940) 50ms;` workaround: use the shorthand property directly. ## ğŸŒ Your Environment **Angular Version:** 

8.0.3
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "Production build, css minification of transition properties." (#31081)

Issues.Title: perf(ivy): chain multiple property instructions
Issues.Body:
Currently each property binding generates an instruction like this:

```
property('prop1', ctx.value1);
property('prop2', ctx.value2);
```

The problem is that we're repeating the call to `property` for each of the properties. Since the `property` instruction returns itself, we can chain all of the calls which is more compact and it looks like this:

```
property('prop1', ctx.value1)('prop2', ctx.value2);
```

These changes implement the chaining behavior for regular property bindings and for synthetic ones, however interpolated ones are still handled like before, because they use a separate instruction.

This PR resolves FW-1389.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open PR "perf(ivy): chain multiple property instructions" (#31078)

Issues.Title: How to force index.html to be loaded from server in any browsers using Angular 2 code if it was cached
Issues.Body: Currently I am hosting an Angular 2 application on Apache 2.4 web server and in client's browser latest website changes are not rendered after new production deployment! I found that index.html is cached by the browser. All css and angular bundle file linking can be done on index.html,so it is entry point of the application. We have thousands of active users so we cannot insist them to press CTRL+F5 or do hard reload. I have checked with different ways of production build (for example, Thread1, Thread2), index.html also contains following meta tags already. ``` ``` Using angular code, I have checked with cache busting by query param and also followed up a good practice to use module.id in each component as well. ``` @Component({ ... moduleId: module.id, ... }) ``` So my question is, 1. In this situation, how do I force browser to load new index.html using Angular 2 code in all user's machine? - If it is possible then please let me know about how do i cope up with this issue. Your help will be appreciated!
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "How to force index.html to be loaded from server in any browsers using Angular 2 code if it was cached" (#31077)

Issues.Title: Docs should not use StackBlitz "generator" or other proprietary features
Issues.Body:
# ğŸ“š Docs or angular.io bug report ### Description A clear and concise description of the problem... The documentation uses a number of proprietary features of "StackBlitz" online code editor to explain fundamental concepts of Angular. This obscures the process that is occurring when these features, such as "Angular Generator" are used. This is bad practice both due to the fact that there are many reported issues (just do a quick Google search) using StackBlitz, particularly exporting the default project (see here: https://github.com/stackblitz/core/issues/377) and due to the fact that learning from a process that "magically" generates files isn't actually learning anything at all. ## ğŸ”¬ Minimal Reproduction Here's an example of part of the docs where this is used: https://angular.io/start#input ### What's the affected URL?** https://angular.io/... https://angular.io/start#input ### Reproduction Steps** Read the docs. See the issue. ### Expected vs Actual Behavior** This isn't a bug. It's a documentation approach issue. ## ğŸ“·Screenshot Unnecessary. ## ğŸ”¥ Exception or Error 



Not a bug.

Issues.Title: Latest code/html changes not visible in browser.
Issues.Body:
# ğŸ Bug report ### Command (mark with an `x`) ``` - [ ] new - [ ] build - [x] serve - [ ] test - [ ] e2e - [ ] generate - [ ] add - [ ] update - [ ] lint - [ ] xi18n - [ ] run - [ ] config - [ ] help - [ ] version - [ ] doc ``` ### Is this a regression? Yes, the previous version in which this bug was not present was: 8.0.2 Ancient issue that described the same problem: #5117 ### Description Auto-reload does not reload latest changes into the browser, instead the one before last change is visible. ## ğŸ”¬ Minimal Reproduction 1. `ng new --style=scss --enable-ivy --routing reload-test` 2. `ng g component home` 3. Add `{component: HomeComponent, path: ''}` as route to `app-routing.module.ts` 2. `ng serve` 4. Open webpage on http://localhost:4200 5. Change some HTML or code in `HomeComponent`. 6. Save (Recompile will trigger & webpage will reload). 7. **Change is not visible.** 8. Make another change in `HomeComponent`. 9. Save (Recompile will trigger & webpage will reload). 10. First change is visible, but second change isn't. ## ğŸŒ Your Environment 

Angular CLI: 8.0.3
Node: 12.3.1
OS: win32 x64
Angular: 8.0.1
... animations, common, compiler, compiler-cli, core, forms
... language-service, platform-browser, platform-browser-dynamic

Each new build also has a unique hash, which is strange because nothing changed. * Changes to `AppComponent` do show up when reloading the webpage. (Problem seems isolated to routes)

Issues.Title: refactor(@angular/cli): standardize color handling and support checking
Issues.Body:
Node.js 10+ provides built-in functionality to test for color support based on chalk's `supports-color` package as well as several others. This alleviates the need for custom code or third-party packages to determine color support.  In addition for this PR, the `ansi-colors` package is added to the CLI which provides color, cross-platform symbol, and style/color removal support.  The package is light-weight (~150 SLOC), contains typings, and has no dependencies. The removal support is leveraged to remove all styling from logger messages when color is not supported.  This removes a current defect in which color/styling is still displayed if generated manually or via methods that do not perform supportability checks.  This is very relevant for third-party code/packages.  Finally, the typically used console functions are overriden to leverage the logger to ensure that the color processing is applied to third-party code (e.g., webpack internally as well as some of its loaders and plugins) which output to the console directly.

The color removal capabilities will be leveraged to support improved TypeScript diagnostic reporting which will use TypeScript's built-in functionality that while providing improved messaging and context also includes color.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed or merged PR "refactor(@angular/cli): standardize color handling and support checking" (#14780)

With this commit, we can now specify a `version`
for the `ng doc` command

and this will open `v6.angular.io` instead of `angular.io`.
The default domain is still used
if no version is specified.

Issues.Title: fullTemplateTypeCheck is only enabled for library projects, but not application projects
Issues.Body:
# ğŸš€ Feature request

### Command (mark with an `x`)
<!-- Can you pin-point the command or commands that are relevant for this feature request? -->
<!-- âœï¸edit: -->
```
- [x] new
- [x] generate
```

### Description

Currently @angular/cli only adds

```jsonc
"angularCompilerOptions": {
  // ...
  "fullTemplateTypeCheck": true,
  // ...
}
```

for library projects ([tsconfig.lib.json.template](https://github.com/angular/angular-cli/blob/v8.0.3/packages/schematics/angular/library/files/tsconfig.lib.json.template)).

I would expect this option to be enabled for applications as well, or even better globally in the workspace tsconfig.json file ([tsconfig.json.template](https://github.com/angular/angular-cli/blob/v8.0.3/packages/schematics/angular/workspace/files/tsconfig.json.template)).

Angular's official documentation on [fullTemplateTypeCheck](https://angular.io/guide/aot-compiler#fulltemplatetypecheck) recommends setting this option to `true` irrespective of whether the project is an application or a library.

We have just enabled "fullTemplateTypeCheck" in our Angular project and realized how many errors were lurking inside templates without being noticed. Such unpleasant surprise could have been easily avoided if @angular/cli had prudently enabled "fullTemplateTypeCheck" when the project was started.

Unless I am missing something, "fullTemplateTypeCheck" seems beneficial in all cases.

### Describe the solution you'd like

1. Add 

```jsonc
"angularCompilerOptions": {
  "fullTemplateTypeCheck": true
}
```

to [tsconfig.json.template](https://github.com/angular/angular-cli/blob/v8.0.3/packages/schematics/angular/workspace/files/tsconfig.json.template).

2. Remove

```jsonc
"fullTemplateTypeCheck": true,
```

from [tsconfig.lib.json.template](https://github.com/angular/angular-cli/blob/v8.0.3/packages/schematics/angular/library/files/tsconfig.lib.json.template)

### Describe alternatives you've considered

One alternative is to let developers discover the usefulness of "fullTemplateTypeCheck" themselves. However, my opinion is that it would be nice of @angular/cli to enlighten them (us)  and promote best practices like having "fullTemplateTypeCheck" enabled.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "fullTemplateTypeCheck is only enabled for library projects, but not application projects" (#14794)

Issues.Title: fix(@ngtools/webpack): avoid resetting emit skipped flag when no Typeâ€¦
Issues.Body:
There can be a number of reason why `_emitSkipped` is set to true these are:
- Errors have been encountered
- Changes are outside of TS compilations such as HTML and CSS in JIT mode

We only want to run a full JIT emit when;
- There hasn't been a success emit
- When a large number of files have changed
- First run

If a subsequent JIT build fails we shouldn't do a full emit either as we will transpile only the files that changes after the success build

https://github.com/angular/angular-cli/blob/64243919c10c33775be71010efd5ae69622a728f/packages/ngtools/webpack/src/angular_compiler_plugin.ts#L1029-L1031

Fixes #14775
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed or merged PR "fix(@ngtools/webpack): avoid resetting emit skipped flag when no Typeâ€¦" (#14778)

Issues.Title: fix(dialog): DOM nodes not cleaned up if view container is destroyed mid-animation
Issues.Body:
Currently the dialog's cleanup logic is tied to its exit animation completing. This usually isn't a problem since by default the dialog is attached to the application ref, however if the consumer has set a `viewContainerRef` and that ref is destroyed mid-animation, the exit animation event will never fire. These changes add a timeout as a fallback in case the animation doesn't finish in the specified time.

Fixes #16284.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open PR "fix(dialog): DOM nodes not cleaned up if view container is destroyed mid-animation" (#16309)

Steps to reproduce:
1. comment out lines 36-40 in the app.component.ts file
2. click the "extra row on/off" button. No changes will be made
 
 
#### Expected Behavior

Changes to the content projected `matRowDef`s should be reflected in the table.


#### Actual Behavior

In order for the table to recognize changes to projected `matRowDef`s, I must call certain extra functions in the table (that were intended for other things) - `removeColumnDef` and `renderRows`.


#### Environment
- Angular: 7.2
- CDK/Material: 7.3
- Browser(s): Chrome, Safari
- Operating System (e.g. Windows, macOS, Ubuntu): MacOS

#### Other Info
There is conversation around this in #13030, but I think this issue is different than the original purpose of that issue.

Issues.Title: How can I get flexible position for overlay like mat-select?
Issues.Body:
#### What are you trying to do?

Issues.Title: autocomplete: browser undo function not working for dropdown selection
Issues.Body:
<!-- 
Filling out this template is required! Do not delete it when submitting your issue! Without this information, your issue may be auto-closed. 

Please submit AngularJS Material questions to the [AngularJS Material Forum](https://groups.google.com/forum/#!forum/ngmaterial) instead of submitting an issue.

---------------------------------------------------------------------
This repo is for AngularJS Material, not Angular Material or the CDK.
---------------------------------------------------------------------

Please submit Angular Material and CDK questions [here](https://groups.google.com/forum/#!forum/angular-material2) and issues [here](https://github.com/angular/components/issues).
-->
## Bug, enhancement request, or proposal:

<!-- Please note that we are not accepting major feature requests, i.e. requests for new components, at this time. -->

# CodePen and steps to reproduce the issue:
#### StackBlitz Demo which demonstrates the issue: 
https://stackblitz.com/angular/vvyedjbgonl?file=app%2Fautocomplete-simple-example.ts

#### Detailed Reproduction Steps: 
1. Open the StackBlitz from the Autocomplete documentation in Chrome
2. Select "One" in the autocomplete input
3. Clear the input by selecting the whole word and pressing backspace
4. Select "Two"
5. Press CTRL+Z on your keyboard

### What is the expected behavior?
The input should be cleared, as the last action that can be undone is inserting the selected entry into the empty input.

### What is the current behavior?
The previously selected entry is concatenated to the input text, i.e. the input's content is now "TwoOne".

### What is the use-case or motivation for changing an existing behavior?
The undo functionality is only useful to users if it works intuitively, which means that it should always reset the input to the state in which it was right before the very last user action. If it only undoes certain actions (adding and removing text by using the keyboard) while other actions are ignored (selecting an entry in the dropdown menu) then users may find this confusing and annoying.

### Which versions of AngularJS, Material, OS, and browsers are affected?
<!-- Please note that only issues related to AngularJS 1.x and AngularJS Material 1.x should be submitted here.
Please submit Angular Material and CDK questions [here](https://groups.google.com/forum/#!forum/angular-material2) and issues [here](https://github.com/angular/components/issues).
-->
- Angular: 8.0.0, 8.0.1
- Angular Material: 8.0.0, 8.0.1
- OS: Windows 10
- Browsers: Chrome 75.0, Internet Explorer 11.3
 
### Is there anything else we should know? Stack Traces, Screenshots, etc.
In Firefox the previous entry is not concatenated to the current input text when pressing CTRL+Z. However, the selection of the second entry is not undone, either. Rather the undo stack seems to be cleared completely when a dropdown item is selected. 

<!-- Please double check that you have provided the required reproduction steps and a Demo via CodePen, Plunker, or GitHub repo. -->
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "autocomplete: browser undo function not working for dropdown selection" (#16308)

Issues.Title: fix(dialog): don't move focus to dialog container if focus is already inside the dialog
Issues.Body:
This is a follow-up to https://github.com/angular/components/pull/16221. What we hadn't accounted for in the aforementioned PR is that the consumer may have turned off `autoFocus` so that they can handle it themselves and with our changes focus would be reset back to the container. These changes add an extra check which will ensure that focus is only moved if it's not inside the dialog already.

**Note:** I haven't written a test for this for the same reason as #16221: in order to capture the behavior properly, we need to be able to flush a `Promise.resolve` and the animations in a specific sequence, whereas the tests flush them all together.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open PR "fix(dialog): don't move focus to dialog container if focus is already inside the dialog" (#16297)

Issues.Title: .ng-animating not removed in mat-select in webkit
Issues.Body:
There is an issue in webkit browsers with the `mat-select`.  `.ng-animating` is never removed from the panel element.

#### Reproduction

https://github.com/pburkindine/webkit-ng-animating

In this repro, a `mat-select` and a `mat-autocomplete` are included for comparison, with `.ng-animating` set `display: none` to illustrate the issue

Steps to reproduce:
1. Run the app in Chrome and in Safari (issue also exists on all iOS mobile webkit-based browsers, iOS Chrome and Safari both display the problem)
2. Attempt to open mat-select and mat-autocomplete elements
3. Inspect the DOM and view the classlist on the `.mat-select-panel` element to see if `.ng-animating` is removed after animations complete
 
 
#### Expected Behavior

Both elements should appear to open even though `.ng-animating` is styled `display: none`

#### Actual Behavior

mat-select and mat-autocomplete will both open fine on Chrome, but only mat-autocomplete will appear to open in Safari


#### Environment

- Angular: 8.0.0
- CDK/Material: 8.0.1
- Browser(s): Chrome, Safari
- Operating System (e.g. Windows, macOS, Ubuntu): 
OSX High Sierra, iOS

#### Screenshots

Chrome:
![SS 2019-06-14 at 9 37 44 AM](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/20215564/59516995-2640fb00-8e88-11e9-92f1-456bff3813b6.png)


Safari:
![SS 2019-06-14 at 9 35 06 AM](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/20215564/59517007-2e009f80-8e88-11e9-85ac-c376bba4a751.png)
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue ".ng-animating not removed in mat-select in webkit" (#16295)

Issues.Title: <mat-icon svgIcon="icon_name"> does not resize
Issues.Body:
#### Reproduction and Description

When I use standard icons from [Getting started](https://material.angular.io/guide/getting-started#step-6-optional-add-material-icons) I can easily change size of any icon, by changing css `font-size` property. 
However in my angular material app I use icons from
https://dev.materialdesignicons.com/getting-started/angular#angular-material
to change size in this case I should set css `width` and `height` properties. Unfortunately size of icon remains the same. The workaround is, to set `transform: scale(x)`.

To avoid workaround, `<svg>` should have `viewBox="0 0 x y"` attribute. It can be added [here](https://github.com/angular/components/blob/master/src/material/icon/icon-registry.ts#L523) but the problem is to set default viewBox for `MatIconRegistry`. In my case it will always be `viewBox="0 0 24 24"`
 
#### Expected Behavior

Icon should resize.


#### Actual Behavior

Icon does not resize.


#### Environment

- Angular: 7
- CDK/Material: 7
- Browser(s): Chrome
- Operating System (e.g. Windows, macOS, Ubuntu): Windows 7
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "<mat-icon svgIcon="icon_name"> does not resize" (#16293)

Issues.Title: MatDialog.close() doesn't clear container .cdk-overlay-container
Issues.Body:
#### Reproduction

1. Open [demo](https://stackblitz.com/github/mike88ua/redirect_from_dialog)

3. Navigate to another page by clicking 'Go to another page' button
4. Check `div.cdk-overlay-container`

#### Actual Behavior

```div.cdk-overlay-container``` element is not empty.


#### Environment

- Angular: 8.0.0
- CDK/Material: 8.0.0
- Browser(s): Chrome
- Operating System (e.g. Windows, macOS, Ubuntu): macOS

#### Assumptions
In my code, the `close` method triggered from `ngOnDestroy` hook which might be a wrong place for that.
If the `close` method should work correctly from `ngOnDestroy` hook. Is there any chance to extend `MatDialogConfig` with one more param `Injector`?
#### Temporary workaround
In the example, method `openDialogTricky` has [workaround](https://stackblitz.com/github/mike88ua/redirect_from_dialog?file=src%2Fapp%2Fdialog-content-example.ts)
